GMSPolyUtility Class Reference

Class that holds methods for operations on item gfx data polygons such as elimination of holes and self-touchings. More...

#include <GMSPolyUtility.h>

Detailed Description

Class that holds methods for operations on item gfx data polygons such as elimination of holes and self-touchings.

Member Function Documentation

void GMSPolyUtility::createAndSaveAMapFromGfxData (  GMSGfxData *  gfx,
uint32  mapID
)  [static, private]
 

Help method for debug of half-eliminated polygons.

It will create a new mcm map and add one item to it. The item gfx data is a gfx data that has problems. It will also print the gfxdata to mif file gfxWithProblems.mif.

Parameters:
gfx The gfxdata with problems.
mapID The created map will have this id.

GMSGfxData* GMSPolyUtility::createConvexHullOfHolesOfOnePoly (  GMSGfxData *  gfx,
uint32  poly,
multimap< uint32, uint32 >  holeHierarchy,
set< uint32 >  excludeTheseHoles
)  [static, private]
 

Get the convex hull of all holes of a specific polygon of a gfx data.

The inparam holeHierarchy (defines which polygons that are holes of which positive polygons of this gfx data) is created with getPolyHoleHierarch. Will not consider the holes defined by excludeTheseHoles.

Returns:
The convexhull gfxdata, NULL if no convex hull could be created, e.g. if there were no holes for the polygon.

bool GMSPolyUtility::drawLineTowardsPolyBorder (  GfxData *  convHull,
MC2Coordinate  coordOnHull,
uint32  convHullCoordIdx,
MC2BoundingBox  polyBbox,
int32 &  endLat,
int32 &  endLon,
bool  printDebugs = false
)  [static, private]
 

Help method used in eliminateHoles and eliminateSelfTouch.

It will define a line from a coordinate on the convex hull of the hole or self-touch-part (depending on main method) towards the polygon border.

Parameters:
convHull The convex hull of the hole/self-touch-part
coordOnHull The coordinate on the convex hull where to start drawing the line.
convHullCoordIdx The index of the coordinate on the convex hull where to start drawing the line.
polyBbox The bbox of the polygon where the hole or self-tocuh-part is located. It will be used to make sure that the line is long enough.
endLat Outparam, the latitude end of the line
endLon Outparam, the longitude end of the line
Returns:
True if the line was created and the outparams set, false otherwise.

GMSGfxData* GMSPolyUtility::eliminateHoles (  GMSGfxData *  gfx,
bool &  hasProblems,
set< MC2Coordinate > &  coordsAddedToReverseLine
)  [static, private]
 

Eliminate holes from the given gfx data.

This will create self-touching polygons.

Returns:
A new GMSGfxData if any holes were eliminated, NULL if there was nothing to eliminate (or failed).

void GMSPolyUtility::eliminateHoles (  OldGenericMap *  theMap,
set< MC2Coordinate > &  coordsAddedToReverseLine,
ItemTypes::itemType  elimItemType = ItemTypes::numberOfItemTypes
)  [static]
 

Loop all items in the given map, and eliminate holes from the item gfx data.

This will create self-touching polygons. Only processes on gfx data that have closed polygons.

Parameters:
theMap The map to eliminate holes in.
elimItemType If given, only items of this item type will have holes eliminated, else all items.

GMSGfxData* GMSPolyUtility::eliminateSelfTouch (  GMSGfxData *  gfx,
bool &  hasProblems,
set< MC2Coordinate > &  coordsAddedToReverseLine
)  [static, private]
 

Eliminate self-touch from the given gfx data.

It will eliminate falukorvs and also split up self-touching positive polys.

Returns:
A new GMSGfxData if any self-touch was eliminated, NULL if there was nothing to eliminate (or failed).

void GMSPolyUtility::eliminateSelfTouch (  OldGenericMap *  theMap,
set< MC2Coordinate > &  coordsAddedToReverseLine,
ItemTypes::itemType  elimItemType = ItemTypes::numberOfItemTypes
)  [static]
 

Loop all items in the given map, and eliminate self-touches from the item gfx data.

Only processes on gfx data that have closed polygons.

Parameters:
theMap The map to eliminate self-touch in.
elimItemType If given, only items of this item type will have self-touch eliminated, else all items.

bool GMSPolyUtility::findPolyBorderIntersectionPoint (  GMSGfxData *  gfx,
uint32  poly,
MC2Coordinate  startCoord,
int32  endLat,
int32  endLon,
MC2Coordinate &  interCoord,
uint32 &  nextCoordIdx,
uint32 &  reversedLineNextCoordIdx,
bool  printDebugs = false,
uint32  polyStartIdx = MAX_UINT32,
uint32  polyEndIdx = MAX_UINT32
)  [static, private]
 

There is a line from a start coord (which is inside the polygon poly of a gfx data) to a end coord which is outside the polygon.

Decide the point on the polygon border which intersects with this line. Via outparams the method returns the intersection point and the index of the NEXT coordinate on the poly border. If the poly border was an old line previously drawn to the true poly border, there is a reversed line, and the method also returns the NEXT coordinate on this reversed line = a place where you want to insert the interCoord.

Returns:
True if the intersection point was found and outparams set, false if not.

uint32 GMSPolyUtility::getPointOnConvexHull (  GMSGfxData *  gfx,
int  polyIndex
)  [static, private]
 

Calls the GfxData::getPointOnConvexHull.

bool GMSPolyUtility::getPolyHoleHierarchy (  GMSGfxData *  gfx,
multimap< uint32, uint32 > &  holeHierarchy,
bool &  hasProblems
)  [static, private]
 

Build poly hole hierarchy for a gfxdata, i.e.

find out which positive polygons the holes of the gxf data are located in. It will return a multimap with polyIdx of the postive polygon as key and the polyIdx of the hole as value. Only positive polygons that have holes will be included in the result.

Parameters:
gfx The gfxdata to build hierarchy for.
holeHierarchy The multimap to fill with hierarchy.
Returns:
True if the gfx data has any holes and the hierarchy is filled ok. False if the gfx data has no holes someting failed during detection (example twisted polygons making it impossible to decide orientation).

bool GMSPolyUtility::holesAreTouching (  GMSGfxData *  gfx,
multimap< uint32, uint32 >  holeHierarchy
)  [static, private]
 

Check if the holes of a gfx data are touching each other, i.e.

share one or more coordinates. return True if some hole is touching another hole.

bool GMSPolyUtility::isSelfTouching (  GMSGfxData *  gfx,
coordMap_t &  selfTouchingCoords,
uint16  polyNbr = MAX_UINT16
)  [static, private]
 

Check if a gfx data has polygons that are self-touching = some coordinates within the polygon are shared.

Either checks only one specified polygon, returning the coordinates that are touching each other. It skips if the first and the last coordinate of the poly is equal. The other option is to loop all polygons and analyse all of them in the same way. NB: It is not comparing poly-vs-poly, only comparing within each poly.

Parameters:
gfx The gfxdata to analyse for self-touch
polyNbr If set, only this poly of the gfxdata will be analysed.
selfTouchingCoords Outparam filled with the coordinates that are shared within the polygon(s).
Returns:
True if some of the analysed polygon(s) are self-touching, false if no self-touches are found.

uint32 GMSPolyUtility::mergeItemPolygons (  OldGenericMap *  theMap,
ItemTypes::itemType  mergeItemType = ItemTypes::numberOfItemTypes
)  [static]
 

Loop all items in the map, and try to merge polygons within the items using mergePolygons method in GMSGfxData.

Merges items with the following item types: waterItem, parkItem, forestItem, builtUpAreaItem (for now).

Parameters:
theMap The map in which to merge item polygons.
mergeItemType If given only items with this type will have their polygons merged. Else all item types will be processed.
Returns:
Number of items that had their polygons merged.

uint32 GMSPolyUtility::mergeSameNameCloseItems (  OldGenericMap *  theMap,
ItemTypes::itemType  itemType,
bool  preocessClosedPolygons
)  [static]
 

Merges close items of the same type that have exactly the same names.

No names match no names. Check with mergeSameNameCloseItems method in NationalProperties for when to call this method.

Parameters:
theMap The map in which to merge items.
itemType The type of items to merge.
processClosedPolygons Set to true if to merge only closed polygons, set to false if to merge only line items.
Returns:
Number of items that were involved in the merging

bool GMSPolyUtility::mergeWaterItemsInCOMap (  OldGenericMap *  theCOMap  )  [static]
 

Merge water items in a country overview map.

Large waters are moved from the underviews to the country overview. We need to merge waters that covers several underview maps. This method does it all for the water items: merge items, merge item polygons, eliminate holes and eliminate self-touch. It first checks with mergeSameNameCloseItems in NationalProperties if it is ok to merge waters in the particular co map.

Parameters:
theCOMap The country overview map to process.
Returns:
True if something happened.

uint32 GMSPolyUtility::rmPolygonDefectsAndUnnecessaryCoords (  OldGenericMap *  theMap  )  [static]
 

Remove un-necessary coordinates and polygon defects from item gfxdata, i.e.

any coords that do not contribute to the shape of polygons.

GMSGfxData* GMSPolyUtility::rmPolygonDefectsAndUnnecessaryCoordsFromClosed (  GMSGfxData *  gfx  )  [static, private]
 

Remove polygon defects from one item gfxdata.

Only works on closed polygons. If the provided gfxdata is not closed the method returns NULL.
